snippet: After 36 years in space, the International Sun-Earth Explorer-3 appears to be in good working order, and a shoestring group of civilian engineers is trying to bring it back into Earth’s orbit.
abstract: Skycorp, company founded by engineer and entrepreneur Dennis Wingo, has reached out and made contact with International Sun-Earth Explorer-3, spacecraft abandoned by NASA in 1997 that has been drifting through space ever since; Wingo says team should be ready to fire craft's engines within weeks, with ultimate goal of bringing it back into Earth's orbit.
lead_paragraph: After 36 years in space, the International Sun-Earth Explorer-3 appears to be in good working order, and a shoestring group of civilian engineers is trying to bring it back into Earth’s orbit.

headline.main: Calling Back a Zombie Ship From the Graveyard of Space
headline.print_headline: Calling Back a Zombie Ship from the Graveyard of Space
